medical_history.chief_complaint: Management of invasive breast cancer with minimal tumor burden in a sentinel lymph node.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began four months prior with a screening mammography revealing an ill-defined nodule in the right breast, which was not present two years previously. Follow-up screening showed a 1-cm mass with calcifications suggestive of a neoplasm. A core biopsy revealed infiltrating ductal carcinoma, grade 2 of 3, with the tumor cells expressing estrogen-receptor protein.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Benign fibrocystic changes in the right breast seven years prior, no history of tobacco or illicit drug use, and no medications currently being taken.
medical_history.family_history: Father died in his 80s from leukemia and melanoma; mother smoked and died in her 60s from lung cancer; no family history of breast or ovarian cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Consumed fewer than five alcoholic beverages per week; no allergies to medications.
